WMCapacity-tooltips.tooltip: Makes column selection active with current data set, but removes all currently defined models.
Opens a CSV file from disk.
Choose a currently defined R data frame.
Opens a saved analysis from the disk.
Set response column (0 = "no change, 1="change")
Set change column: (0=no change, 1=change)
Set set-size column (integers>0)
Define a cetegorical column (for defining random effects)
Define a continuous column (for defining slope effects)
Remove column from columns of interest.
Begin model building with specified data columns
Add selected available effect to the model on capacity (K).
Remove the effect from the model on capacity (K).
Add effect to new covariance group
Add effect to selected covariance group
Turn the modeling of lapsing on/off. If models on lapsing is off, lapsing is set to a low value (about 5%).
Add selected available effect to the model on lapsing (Z).
Remove the effect from the model on lapsing (Z).
Add effect to new covariance group
Add effect to selected covariance group
Add selected available effect to the model on guessing (G).
Remove the effect from the model on guessing (G).
Add effect to new covariance group
Add effect to selected covariance group
Remove selected covariance element or group
Double-click on a model to copy the model into the specification above.
Double-click model to use the model's analysis settings
Select a model to see the diagnostic plots for the model chains.
Select a model to see the parameter estimates for the model.
Select row(s) to copy the values to the clipboard. Double-click on the row to see a multiple comparison analysis for that row.
